map_refiner module¶

class map_refiner.MapRefiner(db_path, cols, reads_threshold, column_pairs)[source]¶

Bases: object

A class to refine sequencing maps made through BarcodeMapper in mapping.py.

db_path¶

Path for new or existing DuckDB database.

Type:

str

cols¶

List of barcode or tile column names to process. At least one must be “AD”.

Type:

list

reads_threshold¶

Minimum reads threshold for filtering map4.

Type:

int

column_pairs¶

List of (key_cols, target_cols) for enforcing each target maps to one key. key_cols (str or tuple): Column(s) forming the key. target_cols (str or tuple): Column(s) forming the target.

Type:

list

Example

```python refiner = MapRefiner(

db_path=”my_database.duckdb”, cols=[“AD”, “AD_BC”, “RP_BC”], reads_threshold=5, column_pairs=[(“AD”, “RP_BC”), ((“HawkBCs”, “AD_BC”), “RP_BC”)]

create_map1(parquet_path)[source]¶

Load raw sequencing data from Parquet file or pattern into map1.

Parameters:

parquet_path (str) – Path to input Parquet file(s).

Example

`python refiner.create_map1("reads.parquet") refiner.create_map1("folder/*.parquet") `

create_map2()[source]¶

Remove low-quality or non-designed rows from map1 to create map2.

Specifically:

  1. Removes low-quality barcodes or tiles.

  2. Removes non-designed tiles.

Example

`python refiner.create_map2() `

create_map3()[source]¶

Group map2 by barcode/tile columns and count occurrences to create map3.

Example

`python refiner.create_map3() `

create_map4()[source]¶

Filter map3 by read count threshold to create map4.

Example

`python refiner.create_map4() `

create_map5()[source]¶

Enforce mapping constraints from column_pairs on map4 to create map5.

Each target combination should map to exactly one key combination. Supports single-column or multi-column keys and targets.

Example

`python refiner.create_map5() `

refine_map_from_db()[source]¶

Run the map refinement pipeline assuming map1 already exists in the database.

Example

`python refiner.refine_map_from_db() `

refine_map_from_parquet(parquet_path)[source]¶

Run the full map refinement pipeline starting from Parquet data.

Parameters:

parquet_path (str) – Path to input Parquet file(s).

Example

`python refiner.refine_map_from_parquet("reads.parquet") refiner.refine_map_from_parquet("folder/*.parquet") `

save_loss_table(output_csv_path)[source]¶

Save a loss table of map1->map5 row counts with descriptive labels and percentages.

Percentages include:

  • % of previous step

  • % of total reads (map1)

Parameters:

output_csv_path (str) – File path to save CSV.

Example

`python refiner.save_map_lengths("map_lengths.csv") `

save_map(map_name, map_path)[source]¶

Save a DuckDB table to CSV.

Parameters:

  • map_name (str) – Table name to save.

  • map_path (str) – File path for CSV output.

Example

`python refiner.save_map("map5", "map5.csv") `
